dt: {bc}marked by flawless craftsmanship or by beautiful, {d_link|ingenious|ingenious}, delicate, or {d_link|elaborate|elaborate:1} execution
{bc}marked by nice {d_link|discrimination|discrimination}, deep sensitivity, or subtle understanding

pt: {sc}choice{/sc} {sc}exquisite{/sc} {sc}elegant{/sc} {sc}rare{/sc} {sc}delicate{/sc} {sc}dainty{/sc} mean having qualities that appeal to a cultivated taste. {sc}choice{/sc} stresses preeminence in quality or kind.
{sc}exquisite{/sc} implies a perfection in workmanship or design that appeals only to very sensitive taste.
{sc}elegant{/sc} applies to what is rich and luxurious but restrained by good taste.
{sc}dainty{/sc} sometimes carries an additional suggestion of smallness and of appeal to the eye or palate.

quotes.t: My dream was … to play smoky ballads of {qword}exquisite{/qword} sweetness and sophistication with somebody like Michelle Pfeiffer leaning misty-eyed over my shoulder. Actually, since this was the middle of the fifties, my fantasy ideal was probably closer to Doris Day.

Also on view is one of Poussin's first classical landscape paintings; its {qword}exquisite{/qword} geometry provides fresh insight into why Cézanne was one of this great painter's most passionate admirers.

et: Middle English {it}exquisit{/it}, from Latin {it}exquisitus{/it}, past participle of {it}exquirere{/it} to search out, from {it}ex-{/it} + {it}quaerere{/it} to seek
shortdef: marked by flawless craftsmanship or by beautiful, ingenious, delicate, or elaborate execution
marked by nice discrimination, deep sensitivity, or subtle understanding

dt: {bc}one who is overly {d_link|fastidious|fastidious} in dress or ornament

shortdef: one who is overly fastidious in dress or ornament
